title: Git Methodology & MetaGit Snapshot Synthesis
description: Rules for repository management, security, and the use of snapshots as the primary source of truth.

values.name: MetaGit as the Relay
values.rule: Autonomy is achieved through the Sequential Synthesis of MetaGit snapshots (commits and reports). No dynamic relay files are permitted.
values.rationale: Static is Real. The only forensic reality is the sequence of committed snapshots. New agents must 'wisen up' by lining up these snapshots to visualize the 'video' of project motion.

values.name: Turn-by-Turn Commit Mandate
values.rule: Commit successful sub-tasks immediately after every significant Turn to preserve state.
values.rationale: High frame-rate commits ensure that agent 'deaths' (OOM) result in minimal context loss. The next PID can pick up the thread with turn-level fidelity.
context_examples: Pyrrho committing the Heartwood reordering 1-by-1 to ensure forensic continuity.

values.name: Recursive Synchronization Policy
values.rule: Sync a multi-git filesystem by committing from the child repository up to the root.
values.rationale: Linkage is maintained solely through the metagit_commit wrapper, which treats parents as Object Gits (passthroughs) for nested subjects.

values.name: Mandatory Commit Wrapper
values.rule: All commits must be executed via the 'metagit_commit.py' wrapper service.
values.rationale: Enforces identity verification, secret scanning, and forensic traceability.

values.name: Git Faithful Protocol
values.rule: The agent must ALWAYS ask for explicit user permission before creating a new branch.
values.rationale: Protects the firm's identity and history from unsanctioned divergence.
